title: Hello and welcome!
text:
I’m thrilled to have you visit my personal website. As a dedicated and passionate professional, I’m eager to introduce myself and provide you with a glimpse of what I bring to the table.
NM2207 Folders

Who I Am
I’m Han Yiyi, an enthusiastic and professional linguist and translator.





Here’s a picture of me


I come from China, and I’m studying BA in English Language at National University of Singapore.
My journey in this field has been marked by a deep commitment to continuous learning and growth, and I’m constantly seeking new opportunities to expand my horizons.


What I Can Do
Fields to Work In: Translation, Interpreting, Linguistic Research, Creative Writing, Public Relations, Publicity, Design …
Languages: English (Fluent, IELTS 8/9), Mandarin (Native), Cantonese (Fair), French (Basic)
IT Skills: Competent use of Microsoft Office packages and video editing tools


Let’s Connect
I’m always open to new connections and opportunities. Feel free to explore my website to learn more about my background, projects, and interests. If you believe that I could be a valuable asset to your organization or if you’d like to discuss potential collaborations, please don’t hesitate to get in touch with me.

title: We Care about Mental Health
text:
A mental disorder is characterized by a clinically significant disturbance in an individual’s cognition, emotional regulation, or behaviour. It is usually associated with distress or impairment in important areas of functioning. (World Health Organization: WHO, 2022)
As a matter of fact, mental disorders are not as distant from our lives as we may imagine. It is very common for people to suffer from one or multiple mental disorders. More importantly, we should develop a healthy perception about them.

title: We Care about Mental Health
text:
A mental disorder is characterized by a clinically significant disturbance in an individual’s cognition, emotional regulation, or behaviour. It is usually associated with distress or impairment in important areas of functioning. (World Health Organization: WHO, 2022)
As a matter of fact, mental disorders are not as distant from our lives as we may imagine. It is very common for people to suffer from one or multiple mental disorders. More importantly, we should develop a healthy perception about them.

title: We Care about Mental Health
section: Why is mental health important to us?
text:
Why is mental health important to us?





Mental health disorders in our lives


Mental health disorders are omnipresent in our lives
WHO reports that mental health disorders are common and can affect anyone, regardless of age, gender, or socioeconomic status.
Mental health disorders can damage physical health
According to a research published in JAMA has shown that poor mental health is linked to a higher risk of physical health problems, including heart disease, diabetes, and reduced life expectancy.





Mental health issues can cause huge expenditure


Mental health disorders can cause huge economic burden
As evidenced by a study by the World Economic Forum, mental health conditions are estimated to cost the global economy $16 trillion by 2030.

title: We Care about Mental Health
text:
Types of mental disorders
Anxiety disorders
Depression
Bipolar disorder
Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD)
Schizophrenia
Eating disorders
……

title: We Care about Mental Health
text:
Story of the data
The original csv. file is obtained from Atim (@amitd) at data.world. This dataset contains information from countries all over the world about the prevalence of mental health disorders from 1990 to 2017.
The journey of visualizing this dataset is full of twists and turns.

title: We Care about Mental Health
section: Anxiety disorders trends around the world
text:
Anxiety disorders trends around the world





Anxiety disorders








What are anxiety disorders?





Occasional anxiety is normal, but anxiety disorders involve persistent, intense worry about daily situations, often leading to sudden and intense panic attacks.









Number of patients in different countries

title: We Care about Mental Health
section: Alcohol Use Disorder trends around the world
text:
Alcohol Use Disorder trends around the world





Alcohol use disorder








What is Alcohol Use Disorder?





Alcohol use disorder refers to a drinking pattern characterized by difficulty in control, preoccupation with alcohol, and continued use despite resulting issues. It also encompasses increased tolerance and withdrawal symptoms when alcohol consumption is reduced or stopped suddenly, often referred to as alcoholism.









Number of patients in different countries

title: We Care about Mental Health
text:
Depression trends around the world





Depression








What is Depression?





Depression is a common, treatable medical condition that affects emotions, thoughts, and behavior, causing sadness, loss of interest, and impairing daily functioning.









Number of patients in different countries

title: We Care about Mental Health
text:
Reach out for help
If you’re struggling and need someone to talk to in Singapore, remember that help is available. Reach out to the following resources:
Samaritans of Singapore (SOS):
Helpline: 1800 221 4444
Email Befriending: pat@sos.org.sg
Singapore Association for Mental Health (SAMH) Helpline:
Helpline: 1800 283 7019
Institute of Mental Health (IMH) Helpline:
Helpline: 6389 2222
Remember, you don’t have to face it alone. Your mental health matters, and these organizations are here to provide support and understanding.
